titleStmt.title: Ray J. Hardin et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2348

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E Bramlett.
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned your petitioners respectfully represent that some time ago a vacancy occurred and now Exists in the office of a justice of the Peace in and for Daviess County Ky in district No 2 and it is very important that this vacancy should be supplied by the appointment of a suitable officer.

J P Washburn is a Citizen of said County in said district and has resided in Owensboro for the past Twenty five years. He is a man of Experience and fair ability and we are satisfied that he would discharge the duties of said office faithfully
We respectfully request your Excellency to appoint Mr Washburn to fill such vacancy until an Election can be had

Ray J Hardin
S S Watkins
Ward Payne
T H Winstead
W S. McFarland County Atty
A M C Simmons
Geo. W. Swoope
Jesse Moore
N B. Allen
James Conway
W. Crow

Citizens Daviess Co
To } Petition
Governor Commth
appointment made as recommended by County Judge he having recommended Benj Alsop
